# dokploy_api_key (Resource)

Manages an API key in Dokploy. The API key value is only available after creation and stored in state as sensitive.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the API key.

### Optional

- `expires_in` (Number) Time in seconds until the API key expires. Minimum is 86400 (1 day). If not set, the key does not expire.
- `organization_id` (String) The organization ID to associate the API key with. If not specified, uses the current organization.
- `rate_limit_enabled` (Boolean) Whether rate limiting is enabled for this API key. Defaults to true.
- `rate_limit_max` (Number) Maximum number of requests allowed within the time window. Defaults to 10.
- `rate_limit_time_window` (Number) Time window in milliseconds for rate limiting. Defaults to 86400000 (24 hours).

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the API key was created.
- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether the API key is enabled.
- `expires_at` (String) The timestamp when the API key expires.
- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the API key.
- `key` (String, Sensitive) The actual API key value. Only available after creation and stored securely in state.
- `start` (String) The first few characters of the API key for identification.
- `user_id` (String) The ID of the user who owns this API key.
